result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Daniels III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Not called on the record. Joy  questioned about defendant leaving the state. Court indicates if it is not a bond condition, there shouldn't be a problem. Joy indicates DOC wanted order from the court. Court informs Joy issue is not up the the court, but up to DOC.
Order for payment plan and summary

Called 16CM153 & 16CM110. Defendant Robert J. Daniels not in court. Called 3:24 PM. FTR recorded. Court due to non appearance enters payment plan order by combining both cases into a payment plan of $200/month, commencing 1/15/17.
Payment hearing on December 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J. Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:57 PM. Called 16CF178, 16CM110, 16CM153 and 16CT24. Court - here for INIT on 16CF178 and FPT on all other matters. Joy and Daniels have complaint on 16CF178, waives reading of it, requests PH. Court considers time limits waived and sets for PH on 10/19/16 at 3:00 PM. State - on 16CM110 - plead to only count with a joint recommnendation of 10 days in DC jail and court costs only; on 16CM153 - plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged, DRI #3, #2 - amend to county ordinance of BJ with $1000 fine plus costs, on count #1 - 20 days in FC jail - consecutive to jail time on 16CM110, and costs;  on 16CT24 - plead to count #1 and #3 as alleged, #2 - dismissed, acknowledge two prior OWI convictions, joint recommendation to withhold sentenc and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: on count #1 - 45 days conditional jail, $1744.00 fine, 24 month DL revocation, did not discuss IID; count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #1, with conditions of: $500 fine plus costs, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession or entry, employment/school, 100 hours of community service. Joy and Daniels agree. Daniels pleads G to count #2 as alleged on 16CM110. Court amends #2 on 16CM153 to county ordinance of bail jumping, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO. Court dismisses and reads in count #3 on 16CM153. Daniels pleads G to counts #1 and #3 as alleged on 16CT24. Court dismisses count #2 on 16CT24. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently wiaved his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - understands that the defendant has secured inpatient treatment starting today and has no objections to delaying the report time for that to happen but it is up to the Court. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for time to report for stated reasons - credit for 15 days on 16CT24, 2 days credit on 16CM110 and credit for 7 days on 16CM153 (stiplulated to). Daniels makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM110 - count #1 - 10 days in FC jail with credit for 2 days - huber and good time allowed, costs - 60 DTP/CO; 16CM153 - count #1 - 20 days in FC jail - credit for 7 days - consecuitive to jail time on 16CM110 - huber and good time allowed, costs - 60 DTP/CO; 16CT24 - counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and on entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, obtain GED, 100 hours of community servie - to be completed within first year of probation, attend at least one AA/NA or similar treatment program each week, on count #1 - 45 days of conditional jail - stayed - consecutive to j ail time on 16CM153 - huber and good time allowed - credit for 15 days only if revoked - jail time is stayed until 8:30 AM on 10/28/16 - eligible for community service under 973.013 - jail time is consecutive to jail time on 16CM110 and 16CM153  $1744.00 fine, 24 month DL revocation, IID on DL and any vehicles titled in his name for 24 months commencing upon issuance of valid DL, #3 - $500.00 fine plus costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on September 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant Robert J. Daniels in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:56 AM. Daniels has the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney. Daniels understands charges and penalties, states he has Jeff Joy. Court will recess until Joy appears in person. At this point, court continues bond. Recess at 9:58 AM. Recalled at 10: 28 AM. Attorney Joy now appears in person for the defendant. Joy has complaint, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, set for FPT. Joy asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons - $500.00 cash. State - bond - no objections to reduction in bond. Court modifies bond to $500 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Court now reduces bond to $2500.00 signature with conditions as stated previously.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
